properties.displayName: _CSGP: Endpoint: Possible C2 - Anomalous Remote Tunnelling
properties.description:
Description: Threat actors use embedded reverse shell (remote tunnelling) to perform C2 attack.

Handling Guidance: Look for InitiatingProcessFolderPath to see what initiated the event (downloads folder is likely a big red flag) and Look at device events for activity around this timeline.

alertDetailsOverride.alertDisplayNameFormat: Possible C2 - Anomalous VSCode Remote Tunnelling
alertDetailsOverride.alertDescriptionFormat:
Description: 
Threat actors may use VSCode embedded reverse shell (remote tunnelling) to obtain command and control on a device using Microsoft signed binaries. This analytic looks for traffic to the domains associated with VS Code tunneling. We would not expect non-IT users to have traffic to these domains. 

Handling Guidance: 
Look at device events for activity around this timeline for further context.
